what: Using {weatherOz} with the {WINS} for pulses project
title: weatherOz Use Case
text: Summer pulses (e.g., mungbeans) high value crop Queensland grain growers. However, temperatures 40 °C, particularly flowering, can severe detrimental effect crop yields (Kaushal et al. 2016). key strategy plants use minimise impact heat stress evaporative cooling. Ensuring crops well watered prior heat stress event (facilitate high rates evaporative cooling) potential strategy ensure irrigated crops avoid heat stress. However, requires farmers recognise heat stress event coming commence irrigating enough time water entire crop prior event occurring. {WINS} pulses project provides warnings heat stress events likely occur farmers can irrigate crops prior event minimise resulting yield loss. using get_precis_forecast() function {weatherOz} along functionality {mailR} (Rahul 2015). work require list alert subscribers. create dummy set subscribers, locations, email addresses. also need specify email address password. project using gmail account send email alerts. Finally need set forecast temperature threshold trigger alert sent. use {weatherOz} access latest précis forecast Queensland. Now use () loop searches Queensland précis forecast data frame subsets based location subscriber nominated temperature threshold set. part () loop () statement uses {mailR} package send email subscribers forecast maximum temperatures greater equal threshold. email informs recipient dates high temperatures expected. process automated run cron job précis forecast automatically downloaded thresholds calculated daily basis email alerts sent automatically. mungbean heat stress illustrated , thresholds can implemented, e.g., frost events sugarcane harvest using functionality.
code:
install.packages("weatherOz") install.packages("mailR") library(dplyr)  # for filter() library(weatherOz) library(mailR) subscribers_list <-   data.frame(cbind(     c(1, 2, 3),     c("Joe", "John", "Jayne"),     c("Blogs", "Doe", "Doe"),     c("Dalby", "Toowoomba", "Warwick"),     c(       "XXXX.XXXX@gmail.com",       "XXXX.XXXX@hotmail.com",       "123.123@gmail.com"     )   )) colnames(subscribers_list) <-   c("Entry", "Name", "Surname", "Location", "email") head(subscribers_list) ##   Entry  Name Surname  Location                 email ## 1     1   Joe   Blogs     Dalby   XXXX.XXXX@gmail.com ## 2     2  John     Doe Toowoomba XXXX.XXXX@hotmail.com ## 3     3 Jayne     Doe   Warwick     123.123@gmail.com our_email <- "yyyy***xxxx@gmail.com" our_password <- "*password*" threshold_temp <- 40 QLD_forecast <- get_precis_forecast(state = "QLD") QLD_hotdates <-   QLD_forecast %>%   filter(maximum_temperature >= threshold_temp)  for (x in seq_len(nrow(subscribers_list))) {   subscriber_location <- subscribers_list[["Location"]][x]   if (subscriber_location %in% QLD_hotdates[["town"]]) {     hot_dates <-       paste(gsub("00:00:00", "", QLD_hotdates$start_time_local),             collapse = ", ")      body_text <-       paste(         "
Hello ",         as.character(subscribers_list$Name[x]),         ".
",         "
Your mungbean crops at ",         subscriber_location,         "
are forecast to be exposed to heat stress on the
",         "
following dates: ",         hot_dates,         ".
",         "
Consider irrigating your crops beforehand to
"         "
facilitate transpirational cooling.
",         "
From the WINS team
"       )     recipient <-       as.character(subscribers_list$email[x])     send.mail(       from = our_email,       to = recipient,       subject = "Mungbean Heat Stress Warning",       body = body_text,       smtp = list(         host.name = "smtp.gmail.com",         port = 465,         user.name = our_email,         passwd = our_password,         ssl = TRUE       ),       authenticate = TRUE,       send = TRUE     )   } }

title: weatherOz
text: {weatherOz} provides automated downloading, parsing, formatting weather data Australia API endpoints provided Department Primary Industries Regional Development (DPIRD) Western Australia, Science Technology Division Queensland Government’s Department Environment Science (DES). well Australian Government Bureau Meteorology (‘BOM’) précis coastal forecasts, agriculture bulletin data, downloading importing radar satellite imagery files. DPIRD weather data accessed public APIs provided DPIRD, https://www.agric.wa.gov.au/weather-api-20, providing access weather station data DPIRD’s weather station network. Detailed information using {weatherOz} DPIRD data available weatherOz DPIRD Weather 2.0 API vignette. Australia-wide weather data based data Australian Bureau Meteorology (BOM) data accessed SILO (Scientific Information Land Owners) (Jeffery et al., 2001). details using {weatherOz} SILO data available weatherOz SILO API vignette. BOM also serves several types data data XML, JSON SHTML files. package fetches files, parses return data frame. Satellite radar imagery files also made available public via anonymous FTP. {weatherOz} provides functionality query, fetch create terra::SpatRaster() {stars} objects GeoTIFF satellite imagery {magick} object radar image.png files. detailed information using {weatherOz} BOM data, please see weatherOz BOM Data Resources vignette. Following quick demonstration common tasks may wish undertake using {weatherOz}.

title: weatherOz
text: examples vignette assume stored API key .Renviron file. See Chapter 8 “Forgot Teach R” Bryan et al. storing details .Renviron unfamiliar.

what: Using {weatherOz} to Fetch Daily Summary DPIRD Data
title: weatherOz
text: Daily summary weather data frequently used. following example demonstrate can find download weather station data stations near Northam, WA year 2022. example assumes stored DPIRD API key .Renviron file. two stations within 20km coordinates Northam, WA provided. ’ll choose closest, Northam, station_code fetch daily weather data air temperature, rainfall relative humidity values.

what: Using {weatherOz} to Fetch Patched Point SILO Data
title: weatherOz
text: Daily weather station observations interpolated missing values available SILO. following example demonstrate can find download weather station data stations near Toowoomba, Qld year 2022. example assumes stored SILO API key (email address) .Renviron file. 11 stations within 20km coordinates Toowoomba, Qld provided SILO database. ’ll choose closest, Toowoomba, station_code 041103 fetch daily weather data air temperature, rainfall relative humidity values. {weatherOz} offers much functionality detailed vignettes document use get station metadata station DPIRD SILO databases, get extreme weather events DPIRD station network, get minute data DPIRD stations, get APSIM formatted data SILO, get ag bulletins, précis forecasts various imagery files BOM respective vignettes DPIRD, SILO BOM data available {weatherOz}.

what: Appendix 1 - Map of DPIRD Station Locations
title: weatherOz
code: # this chunk assumes that you have your DPIRD API key in your .Renviron file  if (requireNamespace("ggplot2", quietly = TRUE) &&     requireNamespace("ggthemes", quietly = TRUE) &&     requireNamespace("gridExtra", quietly = TRUE) &&     requireNamespace("grid", quietly = TRUE) &&     requireNamespace("maps", quietly = TRUE)) {   library(ggplot2)   library(mapproj)   library(maps)   library(ggthemes)   library(grid)   library(gridExtra)   library(dplyr)    dpird_stations <-     get_stations_metadata(which_api = "DPIRD",                          api_key = Sys.getenv("DPIRD_API_KEY")) |>                          filter_at(vars(latitude, longitude),                          all_vars(!is.na(.)))    Aust_map <- map_data("world", region = "Australia")    dpird_stations <-     ggplot(dpird_stations, aes(x = longitude, y = latitude)) +     geom_polygon(       data = Aust_map,       aes(x = long, y = lat, group = group),       color = grey(0.7),       fill = NA     ) +     geom_point(color = grDevices::rgb(0.58, 0.20, 0.13),                size = 0.09) +     coord_map(ylim = c(-44, -10),               xlim = c(112, 154)) +     theme_map() +     labs(title = "DPIRD Station Locations Available in Weather 2.0 API",          caption = "Data: Western Australia Department of Primary Industries and Regional Development (DPIRD)")    # Using the gridExtra and grid packages add a neatline to the map   grid.arrange(dpird_stations, ncol = 1)   grid.rect(     width = 0.98,     height = 0.98,     gp = grid::gpar(       lwd = 0.25,       col = "black",       fill = NA     )   ) }

what: Appendix 2 - Map of SILO Station Locations
title: weatherOz
code: if (requireNamespace("ggplot2", quietly = TRUE) &&     requireNamespace("ggthemes", quietly = TRUE) &&     requireNamespace("gridExtra", quietly = TRUE) &&     requireNamespace("grid", quietly = TRUE) &&     requireNamespace("maps", quietly = TRUE)) {   library(ggplot2)   library(mapproj)   library(maps)   library(ggthemes)   library(grid)   library(gridExtra)    silo_stations <- get_stations_metadata(which_api = "SILO") |>                          filter_at(vars(latitude, longitude),                          all_vars(!is.na(.)))    Aust_map <- map_data("world", region = "Australia")    SILO_stations <-     ggplot(silo_stations, aes(x = longitude, y = latitude)) +     geom_polygon(       data = Aust_map,       aes(x = long, y = lat, group = group),       color = grey(0.7),       fill = NA     ) +     geom_point(color = grDevices::rgb(0.58, 0.20, 0.13),                size = 0.09) +     coord_map(ylim = c(-44, -10),               xlim = c(112, 154)) +     theme_map() +     labs(title = "BOM Station Locations Available in SILO Database",          caption = "Data: Australia Bureau of Meteorology (BOM)")    # Using the gridExtra and grid packages add a neatline to the map   grid.arrange(SILO_stations, ncol = 1)   grid.rect(     width = 0.98,     height = 0.98,     gp = grid::gpar(       lwd = 0.25,       col = "black",       fill = NA     )   ) }

title: weatherOz for BOM
text: Several functions provided {weatherOz} retrieve Australian Bureau Meteorology (BOM) data. family functions retrieve data files BOM parse local files BOM return data frames; get_precis_forecast() `parse_precis_forecast(), return précis (short) forecast; get_ag_bulletin() `parse_ag_bulletin(), return agriculture bulletin; get_coastal_forecast() `parse_coastal_forecast(), return coastal waters forecasts state.

title: weatherOz for BOM
text: function takes one argument, state. state parameter allows user select forecast just one state national forecast. States territories specified using official postal codes full name fuzzy matching performed via agrep(). ACT - Australian Capital Territory NSW - New South Wales NT - Northern Territory QLD - Queensland SA - South Australia TAS - Tasmania VIC - Victoria WA - Western Australia AUS - Australia, returns national forecast including states, NT ACT.

title: weatherOz for BOM
text: get_satellite_imagery() fetches BOM satellite GeoTIFF imagery, returning SpatRaster object takes two arguments. Files available ten minute update frequency 24 hour delete time. suggested check file availability first using get_available_imagery(). arguments : product_id, character value BOM product ID download. Alternatively, vector values get_available_imagery() may used . argument mandatory. scans numeric value number scans download, starting recent progressing backwards, e.g., 1 - recent single scan available , 6 - recent hour available, 12 - recent 2 hours available, etc. Negating return oldest files first. Defaults 1. argument optional.

text: functions, get_precis_forecast() `parse_precis_forecast(), return data frame 7 day short forecast following fields: index Forecast index number, 0 = current day … 7 day product_id BOM Product ID data derived state State name (postal code abbreviation) town Town name forecast location aac AMOC Area Code, e.g., WA_MW008, unique identifier location lat Latitude named location (decimal degrees) lon Longitude named location (decimal degrees) elev Elevation named location (metres) start_time_local Start forecast date time local TZ end_time_local End forecast date time local TZ UTC_offset Hours offset difference hours minutes Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) start_time_local end_time_local start_time_utc Start forecast date time UTC end_time_utc End forecast date time UTC maximum_temperature Maximum forecast temperature (degrees Celsius) minimum_temperature Minimum forecast temperature (degrees Celsius) lower_precipitation_limit Lower forecast precipitation limit (millimetres) upper_precipitation_limit Upper forecast precipitation limit (millimetres) precis Précis forecast (short summary, less 30 characters) probability_of_precipitation Probability precipitation (percent)

text: functions, get_ag_bulletin() `parse_ag_bulletin(), return data frame agriculture bulletin following fields: product_id BOM Product ID data derived state State name (postal code abbreviation) dist BOM rainfall district name Full station name (stations retired “station” , full designation wmo World Meteorological Organization number (unique ID used worldwide) site Unique BOM identifier station station Station name obs-time-local Observation time obs-time-utc Observation time (time UTC) time-zone Time zone observation lat Latitude (decimal degrees) lon Longitude (decimal degrees) elev_m Station elevation (metres) bar_ht Bar height (metres) station BOM station name start Year data collection starts end Year data collection ends (always current) r Rain 9am (millimetres). Trace reported 0.01 tn Minimum temperature (degrees Celsius) tx Maximum temperature (degrees Celsius) twd Wet bulb depression (degrees Celsius) ev Evaporation (millimetres) tg Terrestrial minimum temperature (degrees Celsius) sn Sunshine (hours) solr Solar Radiation MJ/sq m t5 5cm soil temperature (degrees Celsius) t10 10cm soil temperature (degrees Celsius) t20 20cm soil temperature (degrees Celsius) t50 50cm soil temperature (degrees Celsius) t1m 1m soil temperature (degrees Celsius) wr Wind run (kilometres)

title: weatherOz for BOM
text: output get_coastal_forecast() parse_coastal_forecast() return data frame coastal waters forecast values area within given state following fields: index Forecast index number. 0 = current day product_id BOM Product ID data derived type Forecast Region type e.g. Coastal state_code State name (postal code abbreviation) dist_name Name forecast district pt_1_name Start forecast district pt_2_name End forecast district aac AMOC Area Code, e.g., WA_MW008, unique identifier location start_time_local Start forecast date time local TZ end_time_local End forecast date time local TZ UTC_offset Hours offset difference hours minutes Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) start_time_local end_time_local start_time_utc Start forecast date time UTC end_time_utc End forecast date time UTC forecast_seas Forecast sea conditions forecast_weather Forecast weather summary forecast_winds Forecast winds summary forecast_swell1 Forecast primary swell summary forecast_swell2 Forecast seondary swell summary (always provided) forecast_caution Forecast caution issued (always provided) marine_forecast Additional marine forecast warning information (always provided)

title: weatherOz for DPIRD
text: Three functions provided assist fetching metadata stations. find_nearby_stations(), returns data.table nearest weather stations given geographic point known station either DPIRD BOM (SILO) networks. get_dpird_availability(), returns data.table availability weather stations DPIRD network providing time data availability given period time. get_stations_metadata(), returns data.table latest --date information available Weather 2.0 API stations’ geographic locations, hardware details, e.g., wind mast height, recording capabilities.

title: weatherOz for SILO
text: Queensland Scientific Information Landowners (SILO) data sets constructed observational records provided Bureau Meteorology (BOM). SILO interpolates raw data fill missing data creating data sets spatially temporally complete (Jeffrey et al. 2001).

title: weatherOz for SILO
text: Four functions provided streamline fetching data SILO API endpoints. get_data_drill(), returns weather data SILO’s 0.05 x 0.05 degrees interpolated, gridded weather dataset; get_patched_point(), returns weather data given BOM weather station (point) SILO database missing values interpolated (patched); get_data_drill_apsim(), returns data drill weather data {apsimx} .met class object weather data ready use APSIM; get_patched_point_apsim(), returns patched point weather data {apsimx} .met class object weather data ready use APSIM.

title: weatherOz for SILO
text: get_data_drill() get_patched_point() accept following values. get_data_drill_apsim() get_patched_point_apsim() return canned set values use APSIM, , accept values argument. return following values max_temp (degrees C) Maximum temperature min_temp (degrees C) Minimum temperature vp (hPa) Vapour pressure vp_deficit (hPa) Vapour pressure deficit evap_pan (mm) Class pan evaporation evap_syn (mm) Synthetic estimate (Rayner 2005) evap_comb (mm) Combination (synthetic estimate pre-1970, class pan 1970 onwards) evap_morton_lake (mm) Morton’s shallow lake evaporation radiation (Mj/m (Morton 1983)) Solar exposure, consisting direct diffuse components rh_tmax (%) Relative humidity time maximum temperature rh_tmin (%) Relative humidity time minimum temperature et_short_crop (mm) FAO56 (Allen 1998) short crop et_tall_crop (mm) ASCE (Walter et al. 2000) tall crop (Jeffrey et al. 2001) et_morton_actual (mm) Morton’s areal actual evapotranspiration et_morton_potential (mm) Morton’s point potential evapotranspiration et_morton_wet (mm) Morton’s wet-environment areal potential evapotranspiration land mslp (hPa) Mean sea level pressure

previous_headings: Working With SILO Data
title: weatherOz for SILO
text: Solar radiation: total incoming downward shortwave radiation horizontal surface, derived estimates cloud oktas sunshine duration (Zajaczkowski, Wong, Carter 2013). Relative humidity: calculated using vapour pressure measured 9am, saturation vapour pressure computed using either maximum minimum temperature (Jeffrey et al. 2001). Evaporation evapotranspiration: overview variables provided SILO available https://data.longpaddock.qld.gov.au/static/publications/Evapotranspiration_overview.pdf.

what: An API Client for Australian Weather and Climate Data Resources
title: An API Client for Australian Weather and Climate Data Resources
text: {weatherOz} aims facilitate access download weather climate data Australia Australian data sources. Data sourced Western Australian Department Primary Industries Regional Development (DPIRD) Scientific Information Land Owners (SILO) API endpoints Australian Government Bureau Meteorology’s (BOM) FTP server. package queries APIs FTP server returns data data frame radar satellite imagery R session. Observation data DPIRD’s weather station network available via Weather 2.0 Open API initiative. SILO data available Queensland’s Long Paddock initiative (Jeffery et al. 2001) spatially temporally complete, covering Australia nearby islands (112 154 degrees longitude, -10 -44 degrees latitude), resolution 0.05° longitude 0.05° latitude (approximately 5 km × 5 km). Visit SILO website details data prepared climate data available. Agriculture bulletins, radar imagery, satellite imagery seven-day forecasts available Bureau Meteorology (BOM) via anonymous FTP server. Access DPIRD API requires API key. Apply API key submitting DPIRD API registration form. Access SILO API conditioned supplying valid email address user query. Follow API Terms Conditions DPIRD SILO APIs. Observation data DPIRD’s weather station network also available via web interface. data available mirror DPIRD Weather 2.0 API endpoints. Rainfall estimates also available virtual stations (.e., observational data present) sourced Doppler radar service provided Bureau Meteorology license.

text: Find nearby weather stations given geographic coordinates station code DPIRD SILO weather station networks.  Either combination latitude longitude station_code must provided. code: find_nearby_stations(   longitude = NULL,   latitude = NULL,   station_code = NULL,   distance_km = 100,   api_key = NULL,   which_api = "silo",   include_closed = FALSE )

title: Find the Nearest Weather Stations to a Given Geographic Point or Known Station — find_nearby_stations
text: longitude numeric value longitude decimal degree (DD) format.  Optional defaults NULL.  Required station_code provided. latitude numeric value latitude decimal degree (DD) format.  Optional defaults NULL.  Required station_code provided. station_code string station code station interest.  Optional defaults NULL.  Required longitude latitude provided. distance_km numeric value distance limit search station location interest.  Defaults 100 km. api_key string value user's API key DPIRD (see https://www.agric.wa.gov.au/web-apis).  used which_api DPIRD . which_api string value indicates API use. Defaults silo .  Valid values , SILO (BOM) DPIRD weather station networks; silo stations SILO network; dpird stations DPIRD network. include_closed Boolean value indicates whether closed stations DPIRD network included results. Defaults FALSE closed stations included.

title: Find the Nearest Weather Stations to a Given Geographic Point or Known Station — find_nearby_stations
text: Rodrigo Pires, rodrigo.pires@dpird.wa.gov.au, Adam H. Sparks, adamhsparks@gmail.com

title: Find the Nearest Weather Stations to a Given Geographic Point or Known Station — find_nearby_stations
code: if (FALSE) {  # Note that queries to the DPIRD API require you to have your own API key.  # Query WA only stations and return DPIRD's stations nearest to the # Northam, WA station, "NO", returning stations with 50 km of this station  wa_stn <- find_nearby_stations(   station_code = "NO",   distance_km = 50,   api_key = "your_api_key",   which_api = "dpird" )  # Query stations nearest DPIRD's Northam, WA station, "NO" and return both # DPIRD and SILO/BOM stations within 50 km of this station.  wa_stn <- find_nearby_stations(   station_code = "NO",   distance_km = 50,   api_key = "your_api_key",   which_api = "all" )  # Query Wagga Wagga BOM station finding stations within 200 km of it, note # that it is not necessary to provide an `api_key` for SILO queries of # nearby stations.  wagga_stn <- find_nearby_stations(   latitude = -35.1583,   longitude = 147.4575,   distance_km = 200,   which_api = "silo" ) }

what: Get DataDrill Weather Data From SILO — get_data_drill
title: Get DataDrill Weather Data From SILO — get_data_drill
text: Fetch nicely formatted weather data SILO API spatially interpolated weather data (DataDrill).  daily climate surfaces derived either splining kriging observational data.  returned values contain “source” columns, denote observations derived.  grid spans 112° 154°, -10° -44° resolution 0.05° latitude 0.05° longitude (approximately 5 km × 5 km).

title: Get DataDrill Weather Data From SILO — get_data_drill
code: get_data_drill(   longitude,   latitude,   start_date,   end_date = Sys.Date(),   values = "all",   api_key )

title: Get DataDrill Weather Data From SILO — get_data_drill
text: longitude single numeric value  representing longitude point--interest hundredths (e.g., 0.05) degree. latitude single numeric value representing latitude point--interest hundredths (e.g.., 0.05) degree. start_date character string Date object representing beginning range query format “yyyy-mm-dd” (ISO8601).  Data returned inclusive date. end_date character string Date object representing end range query format  “yyyy-mm-dd” (ISO8601).  Data returned inclusive date.  Defaults current system date. values character string type weather data return.  See Available Values full list valid values. Defaults available values returned. api_key character string specifying valid email address use request.  query return error valid email address provided.

title: Get DataDrill Weather Data From SILO — get_data_drill
text: data.table weather data queried weather variables alphabetical order. first eight columns always : longitude, latitude, elev_m (elevation metres), date (ISO8601 format, YYYYMMDD), year, month, day, extracted (date query made)

title: Get DataDrill Weather Data From SILO — get_data_drill
text: Column names converted default returns API snake_case formatted appropriate, names values analogous SILO DPIRD data named using name ease interoperability, e.g., using rbind() create data.table contains data APIs.

title: Get DataDrill Weather Data From SILO — get_data_drill
text: return following values rain (mm) Rainfall max_temp (degrees C) Maximum temperature min_temp (degrees C) Minimum temperature vp (hPa) Vapour pressure vp_deficit (hPa) Vapour pressure deficit evap_pan (mm) Class pan evaporation evap_syn (mm) Synthetic estimate1 evap_comb (mm) Combination (synthetic estimate pre-1970, class pan 1970 onwards) evap_morton_lake (mm) Morton's shallow lake evaporation radiation (Mj/m2) Solar exposure, consisting direct diffuse components rh_tmax (%) Relative humidity time maximum temperature rh_tmin (%) Relative humidity time minimum temperature et_short_crop (mm) FAO564 short crop et_tall_crop (mm) ASCE5 tall crop6 et_morton_actual (mm) Morton's areal actual evapotranspiration et_morton_potential (mm) Morton's point potential evapotranspiration et_morton_wet (mm) Morton's wet-environment areal potential evapotranspiration land mslp (hPa) Mean sea level pressure

title: Get DataDrill Weather Data From SILO — get_data_drill
text: Solar radiation: total incoming downward shortwave radiation horizontal surface, derived estimates cloud oktas sunshine duration3. Relative humidity: calculated using vapour pressure measured 9am, saturation vapour pressure computed using either maximum minimum temperature6. Evaporation evapotranspiration: overview variables provided SILO available , https://data.longpaddock.qld.gov.au/static/publications/Evapotranspiration_overview.pdf.

title: Get DataDrill Weather Data From SILO — get_data_drill
text: Data codes possible (depending file format), data supplied codes indicating datum obtained. 0 Official observation supplied Bureau Meteorology 15 Deaccumulated rainfall (original observation recorded period exceeding standard 24 hour observation period) 25 Interpolated daily observations date 26 Synthetic Class pan evaporation, calculated temperatures, radiation vapour pressure 35 Interpolated daily observations using anomaly interpolation method 75 Interpolated long term averages daily observations day year

title: Get DataDrill Weather Data From SILO — get_data_drill
text: Rayner, D. (2005). Australian synthetic daily Class pan evaporation. Technical Report December 2005, Queensland Department Natural Resources Mines, Indooroopilly, Qld., Australia, 40 pp. Morton, F. . (1983). Operational estimates areal evapotranspiration significance science practice hydrology, Journal Hydrology, Volume 66, 1-76. Zajaczkowski, J., Wong, K., & Carter, J. (2013). Improved historical solar radiation gridded data Australia, Environmental Modelling & Software, Volume 49, 64–77. DOI: doi:10.1016/j.envsoft.2013.06.013 . Food Agriculture Organization United Nations, Irrigation drainage paper 56: Crop evapotranspiration - Guidelines computing crop water requirements, 1998. ASCE’s Standardized Reference Evapotranspiration Equation, proceedings National Irrigation Symposium, Phoenix, Arizona, 2000. details refer Jeffrey, S.J., Carter, J.O., Moodie, K.B. Beswick, .R. (2001). Using spatial interpolation construct comprehensive archive Australian climate data, Environmental Modelling Software, Volume 16/4, 309-330. DOI: doi:10.1016/S1364-8152(01)00008-1 .

title: Get DataDrill Weather Data From SILO — get_data_drill
text: Rodrigo Pires, rodrigo.pires@dpird.wa.gov.au, Adam H. Sparks, adamhsparks@gmail.com

what: weatherOz: An API Client for Australian Weather and Climate Data Resources — weatherOz-package
title: weatherOz: An API Client for Australian Weather and Climate Data Resources — weatherOz-package
text: Provides automated downloading, parsing formatting weather data Australia API endpoints provided Department Primary Industries Regional Development (DPIRD) Western Australia Science Technology Division Queensland Government's Department Environment Science (DES). well Bureau Meteorology (BOM) Australian government precis coastal forecasts, agriculture bulletin data, downloading importing radar satellite imagery files. DPIRD weather data accessed public APIs provided DPIRD, https://www.agric.wa.gov.au/weather-api-20, providing access weather station data DPIRD's weather station network. Australia-wide weather data based data Australian Bureau Meteorology (BOM) data accessed SILO (Scientific Information Land Owners) (Jeffery et al., 2001, doi: 10.1016/S1364-8152(01)00008-1 ). DPIRD data made available Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Licence (CC 3.0 AU) license https://creativecommons.org/licenses//3.0/au/deed.en. SILO data released Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International licence (CC 4.0) https://creativecommons.org/licenses//4.0/. BOM data (c) Australian Government Bureau Meteorology released Creative Commons (CC) Attribution 3.0 licence Public Access Licence (PAL) appropriate, see http://www.bom.gov.au//copyright.shtml details.

title: weatherOz 1.0.0

title: weatherOz 1.0.0
text: find_nearby_stations() Fixes bug find_forecast_towns() returned values, proper values. Fixes bug BOM SILO metadata properly merged using find_nearby_stations() Fixes bug closed stations included nearest stations using find_nearby_stations() include_closed = FALSE (default). Fixes messages stations aren’t found nearby. certain cases message indicated station_code used latitude longitude provided vice versa. Fixes bug stations meet criteria set user error emitted “x” must {data.table} object. function now simply errors stations either API meet criteria. get_dpird_extremes() Fixes example get_dpird_extremes() didn’t use “your_api_key” examples error checking. Fixes example get_dpird_extremes() didn’t follow package’s standard use “your_api_key” api_key value example. Fixes re-export terra::plot() checks indicated documented return value examples. Fixes issue package data available package called another, e.g., {extractOz} used get_patched_point() validate user-input values silo_daily_values found. Fixes bug results get_dpird_summaries() truncated last results requested rather full set start date end date. Fixes bug DPIRD API properly respond requests Windows OS machines. Fixes bug SILO Data Drill gridded data available enough precision. Added functionality get_station_metadata() returns metadata one station required, commit. Several enhanced checks user inputs ensure valid requests made sending API queries now place.
